Suddenly, Karen Page came to the shop and Nelson jokingly remarked that no everyone can stop talking about his career choice and instead wonder if he was cheating on Marci Stahl. Page then told Nelson that she has a reason to believe that Murdock was still alive, telling him about Neda Kazemi who was rescued from the criminals by the man in the black mask. Nelson argued that New York City has no shortage of vigilantes, and they cannot know for sure if she witnessed Daredevil. Although Page was certain that it was Daredevil, Nelson remained unconvinced, thinking that Murdock was actually alive, he would have reach out to them. Page was angry that Nelson refused to even consider that his best friend might be alive, but he still insisted that Murdock was dead, which made Page leave the shop. Nelson then turned around and saw his parents and the brother who witnessed their conversation in an awkward silence.[39]

Return of Wilson Fisk[]

Back at Marci Stahl's apartment, Nelson woke up in cold sweat, as he had a nightmare with Matt Murdock's dead body. Stahl tried to comfort Nelson, telling him that what happened to Murdock was not his fault, but Nelson could not shake the feeling that while he is enjoying his life, Murdock had to give up his. Stahl then suggested Nelson to seek a professional help, but Nelson told her that he cannot and apologized for worrying her before going to take some medecine. Nelson then checked the New York Bulletin news feed and to his utter horror, found out that Wilson Fisk was released from the custody.

Nelson did some research and found out that Fisk cut a deal with the FBI to give up criminal organizations of New York City in exchange for protection and being cleared of legal charges. Nelson came to see Blake Tower and discuss the issue, while he was preparing for his re-election campaign for the District Attorney's position. As Tower agreed to hear him out, Nelson expressed his willingless to cooperate with the DA's office and reverse Fisk's deal and get him back behind the bars. However, Tower told him that although he tried to object to Fisk's house incarceration on every imaginable ground, but he is unable to go against the federal government who needed Fisk's cooperation.

Refusing to give up, Nelson tried to convince Tower to let him build the case against Fisk, but Tower stopped him, as it was nothing but a losing battle. Nelson objected that it was too soon to give up, but Tower was still unconvinced and suggested Nelson to let it go and move on. Nelson then called Tower out for being hesitant to fight against Fisk because he did not want to risk the re-election, accusing him of neglecting the lives Fisk took, like Elena Cardenas, as the dead cannot vote for Tower. Nelson claimed that Tower must fight to protect the people of their city, but Tower refused to listen to him and told Nelson to leave immediately.[40]

Reunion with Matt Murdock[]

Feeling defeated and helpless, Nelson came to the bar to have a drink, thinking about Blake Tower doing nothing to stop Wilson Fisk, and throwing away a flyer of his re-election campaign. Suddenly, Nelson witness in disbelief how Matt Murdock approached him, thinking that he was hallucinating from the alcohol. Murdock, however, assured Nelson that what he sees was real, and he was actually still alive, as Nelson embraced his best friend. He pondered how Murdock survived the collapse of Midland Circle, as all of them believed that Murdock died in the ruins after his fight against the Hand.

As Nelson asked if Karen Page knows that he is back, Murdock suddenly told Nelson that he was not actually back, which made him confused. Murdock told his friend that he decided to throw his life as Matt Murdock away and live only as Daredevil, which meant that he will not come back to his friends. As Nelson listened, Murdock warned him and Page to stay away form Fisk, as now Murdock will be the only one who fights him, so both Nelson and Page will not get in danger because of him again.

Nelson was still trying to process the fact that Murdock was alive, but he only told him that they should stay out while Murdock finds a way to bring Fisk down. Nelson refused, saying that Murdock cannot just show up out of nowhere, while his friends believed that he was dead, only to get them to stay out of his way. Murdock replied that he made a mistake by becoming Nelson's friend, as his selfishness put him in danger, which only angered Nelson more. Murdock ignored Nelson's words and asked him to pass his warning to Page, so they would not get targeted by Fisk, before leaving. Baffled by Murdock's behavior, Nelson tried to call out to him, but Murdock only walked away from the bar, leaving Nelson confused and saddened.[40]

Returning home, Nelson told Marci Stahl about Murdock's confusing return, while frequently checking the locks on their door. Stahl tried to calm Nelson down, but he was still concerned that Fisk will target both him and Stahl, as both of them contributed to his arrest. Nelson had to reluctantly admit that Murdock was the only suitable for confronting Fisk, which made Nelson feel even more helpless. Stahl suddenly suggested to go on offence instead of sticking to the sidelines, but Nelson argued that Fisk had the FBI on his side, and Blake Tower will not jeopardize his re-election by fighting Fisk. Stahl then told Nelson to run for the position of District Attorney and although he was unlikely to win, the public call for action might get the chances against Fisk in his favor. Nelson was scared to endanger Stahl, so he agreed to fight Fisk directly, although he noticed that he had lost his wallet.[41]

Running for District Attorney[]

Nelson met with Karen Page and told her he will never lie for Matt Murdock again. He then revealed that Murdock was alive, except something inside him was not right. They rushed to his apartment and the neighbor told them Murdock was there. They looked around and found nothing. Page was angry that he let them think he was dead. She decided she would not wait and went to return to work, but Nelson found Murdock's glasses.

Nelson later crashed a party to meet with Detective Brett Mahoney, asking for a favor. Nelson wanted to talk to the cops about Wilson Fisk's release, hoping to unite them. Mahoney told him no. Nelson understood, but then went to the microphone. An officer was annoyed at him for letting out his arrest in a case. Mahoney decided to stick up for Nelson, giving him a minute to talk. Nelson talked about how District Attorney Blake Tower was standing idly by when Fisk got let out. Nelson vowed to put him behind bars if he became District Attorney. Every cop walked over to him to sign up.[41]

Interrogated by Ray Nadeem[]

Nelson's Meats held a party for Nelson's campaign. Nelson was approached by a woman who said she lost her husband in the Bombing of Hell's Kitchen and that Wilson Fisk needed to be put away. She already went to vote absentee for him. He thanked her. He was then approached by Ray Nadeem asking for six subs. He then showed Nelson his FBI badge.

In the other room, Nadeem asked questions about Matt Murdock, one of them being if he dissolved his partnership; Nelson confirmed this. Nelson was mad that Nadeem crashed his party and said all of their work was ethical and legal. Nadeem then asked the last time he saw Murdock. Nelson said two nights ago at Josie's Bar. Nadeem asked if he knowingly gave him his ID. Nelson sighed, figuring out that Murdock stole his wallet, and said no. Nadeem thought Murdock lived a double life as a lawyer and criminal. Nadeem threatened being an accessory to Murdock's crimes. Nelson asked what Murdock was being charged with. Nadeem confirmed it was nothing yet. Nelson then showed him out the door, telling him to vote.

Karen Page then ran in worried as she was interrogated too. She thought Nadeem had everything to figure it out. Nelson believed that he should not have let Murdock tell Page his secret. Page complained that she had something worse than Murdock being Daredevil. Nelson asked her what happened, but Page needed attorney client privilege. Nelson asked for $5 so he could be her lawyer then listened as Page confessed to murdering James Wesley after being kidnapped by him.[42] Nelson asked Page if she touched the body and she said no. Nelson told her that his friend went through something terrible and he had no idea, he felt bad. He claimed it was self defense, but Page said she shot him seven times because she wanted him dead.[43]

A Deal with Matt[]

Nelson was met by Karen Page later who said Matt Murdock went to see her. They talked and Nelson told Page to help Murdock on the condition that he turn himself over to the FBI because they have no evidence on him and he will turn out innocent, meaning they will to. Page asked why he would help and Nelson told her that everyone turned their back on Murdock, and he was not going to. Nelson then met with Ray Nadeem and gave him his sandwiches that he ordered. He then told Nadeem that Murdock would turn himself in, but on a catch. Nadeem would have to hear the testimony of a man named Jasper Evans.[43]

Attack on the New York Bulletin[]

At the New York Bulletin, Matt Murdock sat across from Nelson and gave him a brand new wallet, getting a chuckle from Nelson. Murdock said he would have put money in it, but he was behind on rent. Suddenly, Murdock heard screaming. The lights turned off and Murdock ran to get his mask.

Nelson went into the office only to find a man dressed as Daredevil. The man had killed multiple employees. He looked at Nelson before throwing his Billy Club. Right before making contact with Nelson, it was caught by Murdock. The two engaged in a fight while Nelson ran into a room. He found Karen Page, Jasper Evans, and Mitchell Ellison hiding. He got behind Page, who was holding a gun. "Daredevil" walked in and threw an object that hit the gun out of Page's hang. "Daredevil" threw an object that impaled Ellison before Nelson ran over, punching "Daredevil" twice, only to get knocked out. When he woke up, Evans was dead, but Page was somehow spared.[43]

Speaking Up for Page[]

Karen Page was brought into FBI custody because of "Daredevil's" connection to her. Nelson came as her lawyer and argued with Ray Nadeem saying it was not Daredevil. Nadeem said he looked him in the eye. Nelson rhetorically asked if he saw a fat man in a red suit, does it make him Santa Clause. Nadeem responded saying if he came in through the chimney and left presents under the tree, then yes.

They continued arguing until Nadeem brought up Matt Murdock which Nelson said had no relevance to the argument. Nadeem continued further saying Murdock was not in his custody and Page said neither was Jasper Evans. She brought up how lucky Nadeem was because "Daredevil" killed the one man that could make Nadeem look like a fool. Nelson had enough and left with Page. On their way out, he got a call from Marci Stahl who asked if he was okay.

Nelson returned home and sat down on the couch taring gloomily into the distance. Stahl rushed in worried for his life. Nelson muttered that he was okay, just tired. Nelson pulled Stahl close in and they kissed. Stahl looked at him before throwing him down, making love. Afterwards, they sat and Nelson talked about being as scared as he was in his whole life. Nelson then proposed to get married, but Stahl refused saying that she loved him, but wanted it to come from his heart, not from worry. He went to pick up the mess and found a file that spooked him. He searched through multiple files and was able to figure out what Wilson Fisk was up to.[44]

Public Forum Debate[]

Nelson went to Karen Page to talk to her about his plan, but she told him not to as Wilson Fisk probably already thought of it. Nelson continued saying that it is proof that Fisk broke his agreement meaning he would return to prison. Page finally agreed to work with him on it. She then revealed to Nelson that she got fired for not sharing Daredevil's identity.

At the debate, Nelson called Page, who did not pick up. Nelson stood up, starting his debate and was immediately scolded by others. He continued on to debate Blake Tower, saying he was not speaking about Fisk. He based his argument on Fisk's corruption and held up files for his case. Tower's rebuttal was that he needed evidence, but Nelson continued on. He placed down the file only to see it was gone, Page took it. He quickly ran out humiliated, but also worried because he knew Page was going to do something reckless.

He thought of things Page would do and landed on his nightmare scenario, trying to talk to Fisk. He arrived at Presidential Hotel and told the FBI that Page wanted to kill Fisk. This allowed them to get her out before Fisk killed her. They argued as they walked away as Page wanted him to lash out emotionally. However, Nelson was just fearing for her life.[45]

Ultimatum for Nelson's Meats[]

Nelson followed Karen Page to her home where she frantically packed up to leave despite Nelson not wanting her to. She explained that she betrayed Matt Murdock by revealing to Wilson Fisk that he was Daredevil. They hugged goodbye and Nelson vowed to fix everything. He then went home to find Marci Stahl happy because Nelson's speech was caught on video and became a hit. Nelson's campaign was looking up and Blake Tower was silent.

At Nelson's Meats, Foggy showed everyone the viral video and his father wanted to show Theo Nelson. Instead, Theo pulled Foggy aside, telling him to take back everything he said about Fisk. Foggy asked what happened and Theo admitted that a year ago he took a deal with Red Lion National Bank when the deli was in financial problems. They taught him how to money launder despite him not knowing what it was. Theo further explained saying that Felix Manning threatened him to have Foggy take the words back or Theo, Anna, and Edward will go to jail.[46]

Familial Pressure[]

Foggy was given a speech by Theo Nelson in order to look good for Wilson Fisk. Theo blamed Foggy because all of the financial problems were due to Fisk's vendetta for Foggy. He claimed Theo knew it was fraud, but he did not care as they were only in financial trouble because Foggy left the business. Foggy then got a call from Matt Murdock.[4]

Saving Karen Page[]

Nelson arrived at Clinton Church and was let through by a cop who liked his campaign. Nelson talked to Brett Mahoney and then approached Ray Nadeem. Nelson claimed that he was killing time. He then looked at Maggie Grace until she gave him the signal. He then told Nadeem he was there for his client, Karen Page. He said he was surrendering his client to the NYPD. As an accomplice to murder, she was a state issue, not federal. Nadeem let Mahoney take Page.[4]

The Trio Reunited[]

Nelson and Karen Page drove with Brett Mahoney until they got to the precinct. Mahoney then let her go. Mahoney teased Nelson for running out of Blake Tower's speech, but Page said it was her fault. They thanked Mahoney before leaving to meet with Matt Murdock. On the roof, Nelson told Murdock that he did in fact need his help. Nelson got the the point, saying that life was hard when they thought he was dead. Murdock apologized for everything he did, arguing that he believed was for their safety. The two best friends forgave each other.

Murdock believed that New York City would only be in peace once Wilson Fisk was dead, but Nelson tried to reassure him that they could lock him up in the worst prison where he could not compromise anyone. Murdock believed that he would always find his way out but both Nelson and Page successfully convinced him to give the system another try. Page suggested finding another witness who had every detail of Fisk's activities and keep said witness alive long enough to testify. Nelson said it would be someone with nothing to lose, but Murdock wanted someone with everything to lose: Ray Nadeem.[4]

Representing Ray Nadeem[]

With the help of Brett Mahoney and Nelson brought Ray and Seema Nadeem to Bess Mahoney's home for shelter. Ray was confused on what they were doing. Matt Murdock explained that he and Nelson were representing him as Nelson and Murdock. Nelson then found Blake Tower and made him an offer. If Tower listened to Nadeem, then Nelson would drop out of the race. Nelson further explained that if he won the election, Fisk would control the office anyways because of Red Lion National Bank. Tower then agreed.

Nelson brought Tower to Fogwell's Gym where Nadeem started his testimony. Afterwards, Murdock and Nelson wanted full immunity, but Tower did not take it when he heard all of the horrible things. Nelson negotiated, but Tower did not budge, so they told Tower to leave. Nadeem stopped him saying he will do the time. Nelson and Murdock talked with Nelson being happy they were working again, but Murdock said they were not at the stage of partners again. Nelson assured him they will get to that stage.

Nelson was at the court house when Karen Page approached him saying there was a shootout on the road. Murdock and Nadeem finally arrived and they got him into the room. Nelson was happy that they all worked together again. Nadeem returned having testified and all looked well. Suddenly, Murdock listened through the wall and heard that the jurors had been coerced by Fisk. Under threat, they decided not to indict him, much to everyone's displeasure.

As Nadeem threw up in the restroom, Nelson tried to assure everyone that they would not give up but Murdock seemed to have lost all faith in the law. They did it Nelson's way, now he needed to do it his way. After Murdock left, Nadeem apologized and knocked Nelson out in order to save his family. Nelson then got word that Nadeem was killed in his house. An angry Murdock walked out with intentions to kill Fisk, despite Nelson's sad pleads not to.[47]

Nadeem's Final Confession[]

Nelson found Brett Mahoney arresting Felix Manning when he brought up someone wanting to kill Wilson Fisk. Mahoney told him that that was good, but Nelson said Mahoney had an obligation. Nelson further said that killing Fisk would mean all of the bad agents would return to the work force. Mahoney complied saying that he would give protection around the hotel, but will only send in his C team. Nelson thanked him.

He returned to Fogwell's Gym where Page was still not getting over Ray Nadeem's death. She was okay with Murdock killing Fisk, but Nelson explained that if he did, he will not forgive himself meaning only more distance between their relationship. Nelson was then called by the FBI who wanted him to come in. Page told him not to, but Nelson did not want to become a wanted fugitive.

Nelson walked in and saw Benjamin Poindexter who jokingly said won $50 because they made a bet on whether he would show. Nelson then took a picture of him and the agent, posting it to his web page so the public knew where he was. Poindexter brought him into a room where they found Seema Nadeem, who claimed to be willing to have cooperation with the FBI. She called Ray a monster and wanted Nelson as her lawyer.

Nelson talked to Seema who wrote in a notebook: "they are listening" while talking bad about Ray. She then said she was cooperating to "Save Sami." She said it was "Ray's idea. In the video." Nelson circled the word "video" and Seema gave him a phone. Nelson claimed to do what he can to get them through the hardships. He returned to Page where they opened the video. The sad video was of Nadeem, claiming it to be a dying declaration. He confessed to all of his crimes in aiding and abetting. He then told his wife through the video to go to the FBI and tell them he was a monster. Then get the video to Nelson. He said he loved them before ending the video.

Page said it will not hold up in court, but they could put it out on social media. Nelson actually explained that a dying declaration holds up in court and will take down Fisk. However, they had to tell Murdock before he got too far. Nelson and Page waited outside the Presidential Hotel as reports said Daredevil was atta
